\subsection{Detailed Description}
Main public interface to librsync. 

\begin{DoxyAuthor}{Author}
Martin Pool \href{mailto:mbp@samba.org}{\tt mbp@samba.\+org} 
\end{DoxyAuthor}
\begin{DoxyVersion}{Version}
librsync-\/0.\+9.\+6
\end{DoxyVersion}
\begin{DoxyParagraph}{Id}
\hyperlink{librsync_8h}{librsync.\+h},v 1.\+5 2003/12/16 00\+:03\+:40 abo Exp 
\end{DoxyParagraph}


See intro for an introduction to use of this library.

Callback used to retrieve parts of the basis file. 


\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em pos} & Position where copying should begin.\\
\hline
{\em len} & On input, the amount of data that should be retrieved. Updated to show how much is actually available.\\
\hline
{\em buf} & On input, a buffer of at least {\ttfamily $\ast$len} bytes. May be updated to point to a buffer allocated by the callback if it prefers. \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}

Read a signature from a file into an \hyperlink{librsync_8h_afb2a9cb505daeb8e519d06686f5caabf}{rs\+\_\+signature\+\_\+t} structure in memory. 

Once there, it can be used to generate a delta to a newer version of the file.

\begin{DoxyNote}{Note}
After loading the signatures, you must call \hyperlink{librsync_8h_a1c5553b7439b942d0dad35c8230e7217}{rs\+\_\+build\+\_\+hash\+\_\+table()} before you can use them. 
\end{DoxyNote}

Apply a gloss\+\_\+delta to a gloss\+\_\+basis to recreate the new file. 

This gives you back a \hyperlink{librsync_8h_a99e68494fe0ac6b84f4ecfb646690c35}{rs\+\_\+job\+\_\+t} object, which can be cranked by calling \hyperlink{job_8c_a637e42431bf4df09af378c5a1efa60f0}{rs\+\_\+job\+\_\+iter()} and updating the stream pointers. When finished, call rs\+\_\+job\+\_\+finish() to dispose of it.


\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em stream} & Contains pointers to input and output buffers, to be adjusted by caller on each iteration.\\
\hline
{\em copy\+\_\+cb} & Callback used to retrieve content from the basis file.\\
\hline
{\em copy\+\_\+arg} & Opaque environment pointer passed through to the callback.\\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\begin{DoxyRefDesc}{Todo}
\item[\hyperlink{todo__todo000002}{Todo}]As output is produced, accumulate the M\+D4 checksum of the output. Then if we find a C\+H\+E\+C\+K\+S\+U\+M command we can check it\textquotesingle{}s contents against the output.\end{DoxyRefDesc}


\begin{DoxyRefDesc}{Todo}
\item[\hyperlink{todo__todo000003}{Todo}]Implement C\+O\+P\+Y commands.\end{DoxyRefDesc}

Implements \hyperlink{librsync_8h_a69d928f89dbf5e0df5da101a15ac28b5}{rs\+\_\+trace\+\_\+fn\+\_\+t}, and may be passed to \hyperlink{librsync_8h_ac41a6f21adb5c2f1e085550b84136f19}{rs\+\_\+trace\+\_\+to()}. \hypertarget{librsync_8h_ac41a6f21adb5c2f1e085550b84136f19}{}\index{librsync.\+h@{librsync.\+h}!rs\+\_\+trace\+\_\+to@{rs\+\_\+trace\+\_\+to}}

Set the destination of trace information. 

Set trace callback.

The callback scheme allows for use within applications that may have their own particular ways of reporting errors\+: log files for a web server, perhaps, and an error dialog for a browser.
